name: Thinking Media
overview:
Headquartered in Chattanooga, TN, Thinking Media is the creator of the KeyTrain curriculum for WorkKeysÂ® skills and has been providing skills gap training nationwide for more than ten years.

About us With more than 120 years of collective experience, Thinking Media’s expertise in implementing and delivering WorkKeys and NCRC remediation programs is unparalleled. We have collectively been involved in more WorkKeys and National Career Readiness Certificate (NCRC) and employability credential implementations (including job profiling, assessment, and remediation) than any organization outside of ACT itself.

Company history Thinking Media was started in 1997 by Sheila C. Boyington, P.E. and Dr. Dane R. Boyington as a custom developer of highly technical, customized computer-based training for manufacturing and government agencies such as DuPont, Brach and Brock Candy, and the City of Chattanooga. Today Thinking Media uses a team of over 30 individuals in Chattanooga who continue to develop and expand Thinking Mediaâ€™s products. Local programmers, web site developers, writers, instructional designers, consultants, and a team of national sales representatives in Tennessee, Louisiana, North Carolina, Virginia, Oklahoma, and Michigan form a collaborative network of professionals who work with Thinking Media to develop and market KeyTrain.
